text:
I added a proxy server to my workbench and turned it on and configured my 
browser to use it. Anytime a url that has a path other than the default path is 
used the path gets deleted from the url. For instance, pointing my browser to:

http://www.google.com/webhp?hl=en&tab=iw&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8&q=

The following url gets sent to the server:

http://www.google.com/?hl=en&tab=iw&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8&q=
creator: thads_id@yahoo.com

text:
Works OK for me, as far as I can tell.

Which version of JMeter are you using?

Can you post a simple test case ?
creator: sebb@apache.org
thads_id@yahoo.com
text:
This is using the nightly build and jdk1.4.2_02. I'm surprised that it's 
working for you. The problem I found is that the UrlConfigGui that configures 
the test element that makes the call to the http server doesn't set the 
ENCODED_PATH property of HTTPSamplerBase. I added the following line to 
URLConfigGui on line 113 (in CreateTestElement):

        element.setProperty(HTTPSampler.ENCODED_PATH, path.getText());

The problem now is that this sets the property but doesn't rely on 
HTTPSamplerBase's setEncodedPath method which takes the spaces out of a path, 
so I'm a little leary to commit the fix yet.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text: It is broken in the main branch.  Use the 2.0.0 release where it's been fixed.
